bug.author: thereisnospoon
bug.summary: alluxio.core.client.runtime.io.netty.channel.ChannelException: eventfd() failed: Too many open files after running Alluxio with Presto for several days in production
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 2.0.0 Describe the bug After running Alluxio with Presto in production for several days at some point all queries start to fails with: <denchmark-code>com.facebook.presto.spi.PrestoException: failed to create a child event loop at This problem is related to [this issue]: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/prestodb/presto/issues/13367>prestodb/presto#13367</denchmark-link> I've created. Initially the problem was that after some time the queries submitted to Presto start to hang on TableScan stage. After applying a workaround (submitting each query to Presto using different randomly generated ) the cluster was able to handle the load for a day until all the queries started to fail with the error described above. To Reproduce The issue is reproducible on Alluxio/Presto EMR cluster setup using Alluxio provided alluxio-emr.sh script. It takes up to couple of days of production load to start reproducing the issue. Expected behavior No Too many open files error shouldn't happen. Urgency This prevents us from running Alluxio in production. Additional context The production load on Presto cluster consist of short-running queries (up to 30 seconds). Each query can potentially read several hundreds of files from S3. Also, I had to modify OS max open file limits for the cluster via the following command: <denchmark-code>sudo sh -c "echo 'presto soft nofile 32768' >> /etc/security/limits.conf" sudo sh -c "echo 'presto hard nofile 65536' >> /etc/security/limits.conf"
sudo sh -c "echo 'presto soft nproc 32768' >> /etc/security/limits.conf" sudo sh -c "echo 'presto hard nproc 65536' >> /etc/security/limits.conf" </denchmark-code>
alluxio-site.properties for master contains the following: <denchmark-code>alluxio.master.hostname=ip-10-180-40-66.us-west-2.compute.internal alluxio.underfs.s3.admin.threads.max=150 alluxio.underfs.s3.threads.max=300 alluxio.user.metrics.collection.enabled=true alluxio.security.authentication.type=NOSASL alluxio.security.authorization.permission.enabled=false alluxio.master.journal.type=UFS alluxio.master.mount.table.root.ufs=s3://ecs.walkme.com/ alluxio.master.security.impersonation.hive.users=* alluxio.master.security.impersonation.presto.users=* alluxio.master.security.impersonation.yarn.users=* alluxio.worker.memory.size=20GB alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias=MEM alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.path=/mnt/ramdisk alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.quota=20GB alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.low.ratio=0.6 alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.high.ratio=0.8 alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level1.alias=SSD alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level1.dirs.path=/mnt alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level1.dirs.quota=850GB alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level1.watermark.low.ratio=0.7 alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level1.watermark.high.ratio=0.9 alluxio.worker.tieredstore.levels=2 alluxio.underfs.s3.owner.id.to.username.mapping=06996936cdb7e6b6179a2cef023fc2ccc6c493249e0133eb3c0b86930bb1f0d4=hadoop </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: I want to add a note on this thread that I did some testing locally with our native client. My application was able to create, use, and close our client 5k+ times without hitting any FD limits. I confirmed that resources were being created and closed properly each time. My suspicion is that whatever code controls access to the Alluxio clients is not closing them properly. More investigation is required. Maybe there is something we can do internally to ensure resources are released properly regardless of whether client applications close them or not.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ZacBlanco>@ZacBlanco</denchmark-link> could this be an issue with Presto Hive connector?

I've checked open files by Presto process on one of the workers in problematic Alluxio/Presto cluster using lsof. I can see a huge number of open file descriptors to local Alluxio worker over IPv6: <denchmark-code>[hadoop@ip-10-180-41-144 ~]$ sudo lsof -p 10887 | grep 9999 presto-se 10887 presto 1270u IPv6 335190 Is it normal? No Presto queries are running at this moment.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/thereisnospoon>@thereisnospoon</denchmark-link> can you specify the presto version you were using?

Per <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/10020>#10020</denchmark-link> this is an presto issue: <denchmark-code>Based on my testing think the blame is on presto for opening so many file descriptors. There was a bug opened recently on Presto's airlift framework which they use for IPC. See airlift/airlift#781 (comment). I left a comment on this issue with a graph showing the results of the types of open FDs.
Basically, it seemed they were leaking connections. During my testing I tracked the use of FDs by some of the presto processes while simultaneously running many queries. I found that most open FDs in the presto process were actually open sockets. Alluxio itself only held maybe 200-300 open files.
As for ways to alleviate the issue:
Increase the per-process FD limit across all nodes in the cluster Scale out the cluster horizontally by using smaller nodes. YMMV with this approach depending on how well presto distributes work. </denchmark-code>
Closing this issue - please reopen if you need additional help.
